text:
IDK what's going on under the hood, but `arr.index(Integer)` failing when `arr = [Long]` seems a bit silly

```int_var = 53
int_var (Long: 53)
int_var == (53|int) true
int_var_arr [(Long: 53)]
int_var_arr.index(53) (Integer: 0)
int_var_arr.index(53|int) (Integer: -1)
search = 53 (Long: 53)
int_var_arr.index(search) (Integer: 0)
search = 53|int (Integer: 53)
int_var_arr.index(search) (Integer: -1)```

Hello guys! Is there a way to pull more blog posts than 200 from a blog? I am using <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#blog-recent-posts|blog_recent_posts> for my blog listing page, which limits only to 200 posts. I was thinking of using some reverse request to pull posts from oldest to newest and then combine two lists excluding repeated blog posts but there is no parameter that this function takes to reverse pull. Thank you!
There a  reason we canâ€™t access global module values with `content.widgets` dict?

this seems like a missing, vital feature, no?
any insight for the community <@U7SL518D6>

The data should still be available in dev info but I'd think it wouldn't be in the content object of the page, since that's not where the data for global content would be stored. (Global content needs to be accessible from multiple pages)

My recommendation is to open developer info and look for a text string thats in the value of your global content. That should help you identify the appropriate variable.
yeah I did all of that. Still not in there (dev info) :cry:

hi everyone I know how to create a script to count words and output word minutes for a blog post but does anyone know of any variables to scan a page for word count not specifically a blog? basically all content instead of `{% set initialPostWords = content.post_body|striptags|wordcount %}`it would be `{% set initialPostWords = content.*****|striptags|wordcount %}`
Maybe check `all_widgets` or `container_widgets` and see whatever you can glean from there using HubL, you could also do some JS thing if that's good for your use case.
